messages.title: Time to try something Different!
messages.content: You will shortly be receiving your ballot papers through the post. In the Welsh Assembly Elections, you will have TWO votes. One for a Constituency Assembly Member (on the coloured ballot paper), and one for Regional Assembly Members (on the WHITE ballot paper).

keyPolicies.policyDescription: UKIP opposes the Assembly receiving full law-making powers, which almost 300,000 people voted against. UKIP wishes to represent the people's wishes in the chamber, not those of politicians.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Proportional Representation means a vote for UKIP is NOT a wasted vote.

issues.environment: UKIP will address issues such as the siting of Wind-Farms close to homes.
issues.governance: UKIP is the only party that opposed full law-making powers for the Assembly. UKIP aims to represent the people's wishes over those of politicians.

images.caption: Leaflet cover with text 'Time to try something Different!' along with the UKIP logo.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet encourages strategic voting by using the second vote on the WHITE ballot for UKIP, claiming that support for UKIP is growing across Wales & the UK.
